title: Calories in 1 lb Ground Turkey
meta_description: Discover calories in ground turkey 1 lb, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown per 100 g basis, and easy tweaks for cooking variations.
assumptions: 93% lean ground turkey, raw weight, no added fat, seasonings, or fillers; 1 lb ≈ 454 g.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by leanness percentage, brand, farming practices, and preparation method. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 1 lb of 93% lean ground turkey provides ~681 kcal and ~86 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tbsp oil when cooking per 100 g

faqs.q: How many calories in 1 lb of ground turkey?
faqs.a: About 681 kcal for 93% lean raw ground turkey.

faqs.q: What's the protein in 1 lb ground turkey?
Is ground turkey lower in fat than beef?
faqs.a: Yes, 93% lean turkey has ~8 g fat per 100 g vs. ~15-20 g in similar ground beef.

faqs.q: Calories in cooked vs. raw ground turkey?
faqs.a: Cooked (pan-broiled) is higher per 100 g due to water loss, around 170 kcal; totals depend on yield.

faqs.q: How does leanness affect calories in ground turkey?
faqs.a: Leaner (99%) is ~105 kcal/100 g; 85% lean is ~180 kcal/100 g—adjust based on label.
